alert.note: Alert for Imperial County Southwest (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued June 12 at 10:20PM PDT until June 14 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM MONDAY TO 3 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...West winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Southwest corner of Imperial County. * WHEN...From 2 PM Monday to 3 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne. Minor tree damage possible.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution. Continue to monitor NWS forecasts, broadcast outlets, and local government for updates.
